meta.title: Dental Product Sample Access Survey
meta.description: Understanding how dental professionals discover and access new product samples

questions.q: Are you a licensed dental professional currently practicing in the United States?
How many years have you been practicing dentistry?
What best describes your current practice setting?
What is your primary role in dental purchasing decisions at your practice?
choices: I have no role in purchasing

questions.q: How many patients did you typically see per week in the past month?
Which product categories have you personally tried new products in during the past year?
How often did you receive free product samples from dental suppliers in the past 12 months?
On a scale of 1-5, how satisfied were you with your access to new product samples in the past year? (1=Very dissatisfied, 5=Very satisfied)
Which challenges did you personally experience when trying to obtain product samples in the past year?
choices: No time to attend trade shows
Sales reps rarely visit my practice
Samples only available for large orders

questions.q: Describe a specific situation where you wanted to try a new dental product but couldn't get a sample.
How did you typically discover new dental products in the past year?
How many dental trade shows or conferences did you attend in person in the past 2 years?
When you last tried a new dental product, how did you obtain it?
What workarounds have you used to access product samples you couldn't get through normal channels?
In the past year, did limited sample access ever prevent you from adopting a potentially better product?
How much money did you estimate spending on full-price products that you later regretted purchasing in the past year?
On a scale of 1-5, how important was staying current with new products to your practice's competitiveness in the past year? (1=Not important, 5=Very important)
Describe how limited access to new products affected a treatment decision you made in the past year.
Have you ever paid for a subscription service that delivered products or samples to your practice or home?
What was the highest monthly fee you paid for any professional subscription service in the past year?
When you last received a multi-vendor sample package (e.g., at a conference), how valuable was it compared to single-vendor samples?
What factors most influenced your past decisions to pay for convenience-based professional services?
What would have made past sample-access experiences better for you?
